intro: Sida heterophylla, commonly known as the variableleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to linear, depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer, and its hairy stems and leaves are typical of the Malvaceae family. Sida heterophylla is often found in disturbed soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical variability makes it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
